div.p:
Reconstructions of Holocene northern Africa. a Palaeoclimate reconstructions
3 showing the existence of wet conditions (thick solid lines), semi-arid conditions (thin solid) or arid conditions (dashed). The individual reconstructions are colored by region: Central Sahara (Blue), Eastern Sahara (Red), the Atlas & Hoggar Mountains (Orange). The records discussed in the text are Lake Yoa
17 (green) and marine cores
13, 14 (black), whilst records outside of the population regions are coloured gray. The records shown in order of their wet/dry transition, and the total number of wet/dry transitions is shown for each 500â€‰year period. b Probability density of dated archaeological finds for the three regions in northern Africa, which can be used to infer the relative populations
22
